title: Getting Started
summary: Complete guide to installing and setting up your first Nostalgi2D project.

content.text: This guide will walk you through everything you need to get started with Nostalgi2D, from installing prerequisites to running your first game.
System Requirements

items: Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)
Code editor (VS Code recommended for best TypeScript support)

content.text: Installing Node.js
If you don't have Node.js installed, download it from the official website:

content.code:
# Check if Node.js is installed
node --version

# Check if npm is installed
npm --version

content.text: Creating a New Game Project
To start a new game outside the monorepo:

content.code:
mkdir my-nostalgi2d-game
cd my-nostalgi2d-game
npm init -y
npm install @nostalgi2d/engine
npm install -D typescript vite
npx tsc --init

content.text: Create a simple index.html and src/main.ts to get started. See the Hello World tutorial for a complete example.

content.text: Building for Production
To build your game for production deployment:

content.code:
npm run build --filter=client

# Output will be in apps/client/dist/

content.text: The build output can be deployed to any static hosting service (Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages, etc.).
Troubleshooting
Common issues and solutions:

items: Port already in use: Change the port in vite.config.ts or kill the process using the port
Module not found: Run npm install again from the src directory
TypeScript errors: Ensure you're using TypeScript 5.x or higher
Build fails: Clear node_modules and reinstall: rm -rf node_modules && npm install
